text.div:
French

Narratif généré : DéfinitionStructure BeModelProblem

Langue : en

NomDrapeauxCard.TypeDescription et contraintes
BeModelProblem 0..*BaseProblème Modèle logique
identifier 1..1IdentifierIdentifiant de l'entreprise
recordedDate 1..1dateTimeDate d'enregistrement
recorder 1..1IdentifierEnregistreur
asserter 0..1IdentifierAsserteur
subject 1..1Reference(Patient)Patient
cause 0..1Reference(Condition | Procedure | MedicationAdministration | Immunization | MedicationStatement)Cause
category 0..*CodeableConceptCatégorie
Binding: Problem Category Value Set (required)
code 1..1CodeableConceptCode
Binding: Problem Code Value Set (required)
clinicalStatus 1..1CodeableConceptÉtat clinique
Binding: ConditionClinicalStatusCodes (required)
verificationStatus 0..1CodeableConceptStatut de vérification
Binding: ConditionVerificationStatus (required)
diseaseCourse 0..1CodeableConceptÉvolution de la maladie
Binding: Condition Disease Course Value Set (required)
symptom 0..*CodeableConceptSymptôme
severity 0..1CodeableConceptSévérité
Binding: Condition/DiagnosisSeverity (required)
bodySite 0..*CodeableConceptSite du corps
localisation 1..1CodeableConceptLocalisation du corps
Binding: https://www.ehealth.fgov.be/standards/fhir/core-clinical/ValueSet/be-vs-bodysite (required)
laterality 0..1CodeableConceptLatéralité du corps
Binding: https://www.ehealth.fgov.be/standards/fhir/core-clinical/ValueSet/be-vs-laterality (required)
onset[x] 0..1Onset
onsetDateTimedateTime
onsetPeriodPeriod
onsetRangeRange
onsetAgeAge
onsetStringstring
abatement[x] 0..1Abattement
abatementDateTimedateTime
abatementPeriodPeriod
abatementRangeRange
abatementAgeAge
abatementStringstring
note 0..*AnnotationNote

Documentation for this format

name:
Project-Id-Version: FHIR
Report-Msgid-Bugs-To: you@example.com
POT-Creation-Date: 2025-10-21 10:42+0000
PO-Revision-Date: 2025-10-21 10:42+0000
Language: FR
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
title: Problème Modèle logique

element.definition: Modèle logique du problème
Identifiant unique du problème
Date de la dernière modification des informations par l'enregistreur
Le professionnel de la santé responsable du contenu (idéalement identifié par le NISS)
La personne qui revendique l'information (par exemple, le patient, le praticien, le parent ; idéalement identifiée par le NISS).
Référence ou identifiant du patient (idéalement identifié par le NISS)
Référence à la cause première du problème (procédure, administration de médicaments ou autre condition)
Catégorie thématique du problème
Identification du problème - en SNOMED-CT
Statut clinique du problème (actif, inactif, résolu, etc.)
Degré de certitude associé au problème (confirmé, suspecté, etc.)
Évolution de la maladie (aiguë, chronique, fulminante, etc.)
Symptômes enregistrés dans le cadre de ce problème
Degré de gravité du problème
Site(s) anatomique(s) où le problème est actif

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.definition: Emplacement spécifique sur le corps s'il n'est pas prévu par le code
Latéralité de la zone corporelle affectée (droite, gauche, les deux)
Moment où le problème a commencé
Moment de rémission du problème
Notes complémentaires relatives au problème
